alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Shackelford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:23PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Callahan and southeastern Shackelford Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Us-283 Near The Callahan and Shackelford County Line, or 8 miles north of Baird, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Albany around 500 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Mccarty Lake and Us- 283 Near The Callahan-Shackelford County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
